DOC.brief_summary: This pilot clinical trial study Taking Care Her program patient stage III IV ovarian cancer spouse caregiver . This counsel program may equip spouse caregiver skills support nurture patient initial diagnosis treatment . It may also help patient spouse caregiver improve communication cop skill .
DOC.brief_title: Taking Care Her Program Patients With Stage III IV Ovarian Cancer Spouse Caregivers
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Test feasibility study protocol , include recruitment retention . II . Assess short-term impact intervention standardize measure behavioral-emotional adjustment spouse caregiver diagnose woman depress mood , anxiety , quality marital communication , perceive spousal support , spouse caregiver ' skill self-confidence manage emotional toll illness ill partner . OUTLINE : Patients spouse caregiver complete Taking Care Her Program comprise 5 telephone-delivered intervention session 45-60 minute every 2 week . The intervention session design provide training spouse caregiver patient well manage impact emotional toll recently diagnose ovarian cancer , include impact interpersonal communication support cancer .
DOC.criteria: Spouses woman diagnose within past 8 month stage III IV ovarian cancer eligible participate , diagnose wife/partner Spouses patient must marry cohabit intimate relationship least 6 month Have English one languages choice ( multilingual ) Have access telephone Have diagnose prior cancer within recent 5 year , except basal squamous cell skin carcinoma Both heterosexual sex couple eligible Women diagnose stage IV ovarian cancer hospice eligible Spouses/partners could participate patient refuse participation
